column4: I think most ubuntu developers develop for ubuntu as a hobbie
yeah and Ubuntu isn't the only distro
ubuntu can do this now, problem is hardware variance
I know.  What's your point?  The distros benefit each other.
distros aren't all fully compatible with each other, but that's off topic here
I would think that the number of users that use LTS are probably going to give a better indicator of "mainstream" users
I don't tink so,  considering that most Ubuntu users at the moment will be using 9.04 or 8.10 on the desktop
then by mainstream I mean "not hardcore"
yes I mean that as well
so do you agree that LTS users would be less hardcore?

I rarely reboot, but I use suspend to ram

I meant for example  the Touch, Ipod, and  ATI,   issues in 9.04
ah, yeah, I don't have a touch or an ATI card.  I have installed ubuntu on a system with Nvidia hardware though.  Two different systems.  I don't have them anymore though (the systems).
I'd go back to 8.04 if I didn't have to use ndiswrapper for wifi
ndiswrapper  as far as I know works in 8.04 as well
